text:
In the current trunk, the default publication introduces the "links" resource
type (formerly known as doctype), but it is impossible to edit  a links document
through any of the editors:

- Kupu is for XHTML only
- The forms editor would need an appropriate XSL file - not sure if it's worth
the effort
- The one form editor does not work for some bug - but this isn't what we're
looking for anyway, is it?
- Finlly the BXE integration is somewhat XHTML centric
creator: tschlabach@apache.org
egli@apache.org
text:
Yes, the integration of the links resource type is not finished. There are two
options:

1. Rip it out (i.e. rip the sample file, the menu entries and etc. out)
2. Finish it. This would afaik entail generating an rng schema (easy) and
integrate it with bxe (not easy, but would make for a very nice showcase how you
can edit arbitrary xml with bxe)

Source editor should work if the approriate rng schema is there.
